CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Possessions);No violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Civil rights and obligations)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the village of Nemcha in the Kursk region .

CARDINAL . The applicant is an agronomist . When collective farms were being privatised , he left the ORG collective farm in LOC , LOC , and became head of a private farm “ LOC ” ( “ LOC ” ) . In DATE , by decisions of the Head of ORG of GPE , GPE was granted CARDINAL plots of agricultural land DATE hectares from the lands of the former ORG collective farm and CARDINAL hectares from a special State land fund . As the applicant considered himself the sole owner of the land and the other CARDINAL partners in ORG disagreed with his position , disputes began between them . ORG has been involved in various court proceedings since DATE and the land has not been farmed since that time .

CARDINAL . By a ruling of DATE ORG of GPE pointed out violations of law in the setting up and registering of ORG and suggested that ORG of the Kursk region ( “ the FAC ” ) should take steps to remedy the situation . On DATE the Head of ORG no . CARDINAL whereby , inter alia , ORG no . DATE , drawn up in the name of PERSON V.A. Zhigalev , was annulled as having been issued in breach of the law and the rights of the other partners in ORG . Resolution no . CARDINAL of DATE , issued by the Head of ORG ( by which ORG was registered and on which Mr V.A. ORG was named as head of ORG ) was supplemented with a list of CARDINAL partners in ORG , comprising PERSON A.V. Gerasimov , PERSON S.V. ORG , PERSON N.N. Belov , PERSON A.N. Kazyulkin and PERSON PERSON ORG .

CARDINAL . ORG Acting as head of ORG , Mr GPE brought proceedings on behalf of the farm , seeking to have ORG no . CARDINAL declared invalid . The proceedings ended with a decision by ORG of ORG of DATE granting ORG action , on the ground that the Head of ORG had had no jurisdiction to make such decisions , which could only be made by a court with regard to annulment of the land certificate , and on the basis of the relevant documents , adopted by the farm , with regard to including the list of its partners in the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following an application by the Head of ORG , an investigator from ORG initiated criminal proceedings , having detected that CARDINAL copies of a Land Certificate concerning ORG land DATE one issued to Mr Zhigalev by ORG and ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) and the other one held by ORG , which ought to have been signed by the former Head of ORG , bore the signatures of CARDINAL different persons .

CARDINAL . As a result of the investigation , it was established that , on the basis of ORG no . CARDINAL on the allocation of land to ORG , issued by the Head of ORG on DATE , Mr PERSON , former Chairman of ORG , had prepared ORG no . DATE concerning a plot of QUANTITY of land . The investigator found that , as a result of negligent performance of his duties , Mr Kolkov had failed to specify in ORG that the land had been allotted to ORG , and not to ORG alone . He had also failed to register this Land Certificate with ORG .

CARDINAL . Later , on the basis of ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE on amendment of the above ORG no . CARDINAL , issued by the Head of ORG , PERSON PERSON had prepared ORG , no . DATE , concerning the same CARDINAL.CARDINAL-hectare plot and a plot of QUANTITY . It had been properly registered in the relevant records of ORG as no . CARDINAL . The investigator found that , as a result of negligent performance of his duties , PERSON PERSON had again failed to specify in this Land Certificate that the land had been allotted to ORG , including all its partners , and not to ORG alone . Another oversight was that ORG contained no reference to ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE , on the basis of which it had been issued . Furthermore , an original copy of the ORG belonging to ORG had been lost , and there remained CARDINAL copy , that issued to ORG . Mr PERSON had then prepared another unnumbered ORG , identical to ORG no . DATE save that it was issued in the name of ORG . This had been kept in ORG archives . The investigator found that ORG was unlawful , in that it had not been signed by ORG and did not bear ORG official stamp .

CARDINAL . According to statements by PERSON Kolkov , he had considered that , by drawing up ORG in Mr Zhigalev ’s name , he had actually issued them to ORG inasmuch as ORG had been head of the farm .

CARDINAL . In his decision of CARDINAL DATE , the investigator held that PERSON PERSON ’s actions contained elements of negligence punishable under LAW . However , as the DATE limitation period applicable to this offence , committed in DATE , had expired , the prosecution was time - barred . The proceedings were therefore terminated . On DATE a copy of the decision was served on Mr Zhigalev .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr Zhigalev , head of ORG , decided that PERSON A.N. Kazyulkin and PERSON S.V. ORG were to be dismissed from ORG . On DATE the same decision was taken in respect of Mr GPE Gerasimov . The farmers challenged the lawfulness of their dismissal in court .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG of the LOC established that the above - named individuals had always been partners in ORG and not its hired workers . Accordingly , the court held that ORG had had no authority to dismiss them .

CARDINAL . Acting as head of ORG , Mr GPE brought proceedings against ORG on behalf of the farm , seeking compensation in connection with the adoption of Resolutions nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL of DATE and ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE . Mr ORG alleged that the adoption of those Resolutions had prevented cultivation of the land . He claimed compensation for expenses which the farm would necessarily incur in remedying the situation , and for loss of profit .
CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG of the Kursk Region established the facts of the case as follows .

CARDINAL . By Resolution no . CARDINAL of DATE , issued by the Head of ORG , ORG had been granted a plot of QUANTITY from the lands of the former ORG collective farm and a plot of CARDINAL hectares in lease for DATE . By the same Resolution V.A. ORG had been confirmed as head of ORG and GPE GPE , GPE ORG , ORG , ORG and PERSON ORG as partners in ORG .
CARDINAL . By Resolution no . CARDINAL of DATE , issued by the Head of ORG , ORG had been registered as a legal entity .
CARDINAL . Land Certificate no . DATE had been issued to ORG in pursuance of the above ORG for the founding of ORG .

CARDINAL . By Resolution no . CARDINAL of DATE , issued by the Head of ORG , the earlier ORG no . CARDINAL had been amended in order to specify the size of the plot of land given in life - time inheritable possession to each partner in the farm .

CARDINAL . Resolution no . CARDINAL of DATE , issued by the Head of ORG , had concerned the renaming of ORG as GPE farm by its partners and their re - election of the farm ’s head following a vote of no confidence to ORG . It had also ordered ORG to annul ORG issued to ORG and to prepare new documents accordingly . By ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE , issued by the Head of ORG , ORG had been re - registered as ORG . Resolutions nos . QUANTITY and CARDINAL had then been reversed by the Head of ORG , and , when the court delivered its judgment on DATE , Resolutions nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL of DATE were in force in their earlier version .

CARDINAL . By Resolution no . CARDINAL of DATE , issued by the Head of ORG , ORG no . DATE was annulled and ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE had been made more precise in respect of the partners in the farm . By a decision of ORG of ORG of DATE , ORG no . CARDINAL had been declared null and void .

CARDINAL . Having examined the evidence in the case , ORG of GPE found that there was no single document from which it would follow that Mr Zhigalev had been the sole founder of ORG . The court held that ORG had been set up by the CARDINAL farmers ( ORG , ORG ORG , ORG , ORG and PERSON ORG ) and the farm ’s property had been formed from their property shares . In accordance with LAW , the property of a farm belonged to its partners as their common share property or common joint property , if the latter course was decided unanimously by a farm ’s partners . According to the legislation in force at the material time ( LAW ) , a farm ’s property was common joint property .

CARDINAL . The court found no causal link between the adoption of Resolutions nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL and the failure of the farmers to farm the land . The court held that there had been no obstacles to cultivating ORG land . It held that ORG had failed to substantiate his claims and that it was in fact his attitude that had brought about the possibility of losses for the farm .
CARDINAL . In its judgment of CARDINAL DATE the court dismissed PERSON ORG ’s claims as manifestly ill - founded . That judgment was upheld by a decision of ORG of ORG of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor of the Kursk Region brought an action against ORG and ORG in defence of state and public interests before ORG of GPE .

CARDINAL . The prosecutor requested that ORG no . DATE concerning the right of ownership to the plot of QUANTITY , which had been issued by ORG in Mr ORG ’s name , be declared null and void . The same request was made in respect of Land Certificate no . DATE on the right of ownership to the same plot of QUANTITY and the right of life - time inheritable possession to the CARDINAL-hectare plot , which had also been issued by ORG in Mr ORG ’s name . The prosecutor stated , inter alia , that the Land Certificates certifying Mr Zhigalev as the sole owner of the land had impaired the rights of the other CARDINAL partners in the farm , each of whom had been entitled to his share of the land .

CARDINAL . The prosecutor also requested a finding of invalidity in respect of Resolutions no . CARDINAL of DATE , on the allocation of a plot of land for the organisation of ORG , and no . CARDINAL of DATE , on the amendment of ORG no . CARDINAL , both of which had been issued by the Head of ORG . The prosecutor argued that the size of the plot of land given to ORG had exceeded the relevant statutory limit .
CARDINAL . The prosecutor requested that Mr Zhigalev , head of ORG , be joined to the proceedings as a third party on the defendant ’s side .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE ruled that Mr Zhigalev , head of ORG , was to be joined to the proceedings as a third party because the submitted action concerned his interests . The court referred to LAW , which regulated the procedural status of a third party who did not have separate claims with regard to the subject matter of a dispute .
CARDINAL . By the same decision , the court ordered the parties to produce documentary evidence and scheduled a hearing for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court adjourned the hearing to CARDINAL DATE in view of ORG failure to produce documentary evidence .

CARDINAL . The court , composed of CARDINAL judges , held a hearing on DATE . Representatives of the defendant authorities admitted the claim in full . ORG explained that neither of ORG complied with LAW . CARDINAL and CARDINAL , on the basis of which they had been issued .

CARDINAL . Mr ORG submitted an application to be recognised as a codefendant in the case . In its ruling of CARDINAL DATE , the court refused the application on the ground that the prosecutor ’s action concerned the validity of the documents adopted by ORG and ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The head of ORG argued that the prosecutor ’s claim should be rejected in view of the expiry of the relevant limitation period .

CARDINAL . The prosecutor submitted that the limitation period had been interrupted by ORG adoption , on DATE , of ORG no . CARDINAL on the amendment of Resolutions nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL . Resolution no . CARDINAL had been reversed by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . The court held that , in accordance with LAW , a limitation period was applied exclusively at the request of a party to a case . As head of ORG , Mr ORG was not a party to the present proceedings pursuant to LAW , and the court could not therefore apply this ground for rejecting the prosecutor ’s claim .

CARDINAL . Having examined the evidence in the case and heard the prosecutor , the defendants and the head of ORG in his capacity as a third party , ORG of the Kursk Region established the facts of the case as follows , as summarised in its judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG had lodged an application with ORG of the Kursk Region for allocation of a plot of QUANTITY of agricultural land as a life - time inheritable possession ( право пожизненного наследуемого владения ) for the founding of ORG , together with the following partners in ORG : ORG , ORG , ORG and PERSON ORG .

CARDINAL . Following applications by members of the ORG collective farm , namely ORG , ORG ORG , ORG , ORG and PERSON ORG , seeking to leave the farm and be granted a plot of land , on DATE the administration of ORG collective farm had decided that the said individuals would leave the collective farm with a share of CARDINAL hectares each .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Head of ORG had adopted Resolution no . CARDINAL which stated that , pursuant to the above decision by the administration of ORG collective farm , a plot of QUANTITY from the land of GPE collective farm was to be given , free of charge , in ownership , for the founding of ORG . In the same ORG had ordered that a plot of QUANTITY of plough land be given to ORG in lease for DATE . The ORG had further confirmed V.A. ORG as head of ORG and GPE GPE , GPE ORG , ORG , ORG and PERSON ORG as partners in ORG . The ORG had further stated that ORG had been directed to delimit the plots of land on site and to issue a ORG for the right to use the land .

CARDINAL . ORG had delimited the plot of QUANTITY on site , drawn up a plan and prepared a ORG , numbered DATE , certifying the right of ownership to this plot of land , in which ORG had been specified as the sole owner of the land .

CARDINAL . Having examined an application submitted on DATE by ORG , head of ORG , to grant the land to ORG in life - time inheritable possession and not in lease , the Head of ORG had adopted ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE , by which the earlier ORG no . CARDINAL had been amended in respect of the plot of CARDINAL hectares . It had now stated :
‘ That QUANTITY of arable land is to be transferred from a special land fund to ORG in life - time inheritable possession , in the following shares :
V.A. ORG CARDINAL ha [ hectares ]
GPE Gerasimov CARDINAL ha [ hectares ]
ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL ha [ hectares ]
ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL ha [ hectares ]
PERSON CARDINAL ha [ hectares ]
PERSON ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL ha [ hectares]’

CARDINAL . Following Resolution no . CARDINAL ORG had prepared ORG , numbered DATE , certifying the right of ownership to the same plot of QUANTITY and the right of life - time inheritable possession to the plot of QUANTITY , in which ORG was again specified as the sole owner and possessor of both plots of land .

CARDINAL . In the light of the above findings of fact , ORG of GPE found that the fact that ORG no . DATE did not specify the share of QUANTITY belonging to each partner in ORG ran counter to the content of ORG no . CARDINAL and to the law , particularly section CARDINAL of LAW ( « О крестьянском ( фермерском ) хозяйстве GPE ) , which provided that the property of a farm belonged to its members as common share property or as common joint property . The court further held that the same omission – the lack of information concerning the share of land for each partner in ORG - in ORG no . DATE was unlawful on the same grounds .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE ORG of the Kursk Region declared Land Certificates no . DATE and no . DATE null and void . The court rejected the remainder of the prosecutor ’s claim concerning Resolutions no . CARDINAL of DATE and no . CARDINAL of DATE , issued by the Head of ORG , because the court found no grounds to declare the said Resolutions unlawful .

CARDINAL . Mr GPE , head of ORG , appealed against the judgment on the ground that the first - instance court had refused to examine his submission concerning the limitation period . At a hearing on DATE , in which the parties and Mr Zhigalev in his capacity as a third party participated , ORG of ORG of GPE , sitting as a bench of CARDINAL judges , examined the appeal .

CARDINAL . It noted that on the basis of Resolutions nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL , issued by the Head of ORG , the land had been allotted to each of the partners in ORG . Land Certificates no . DATE and no . DATE , issued in Mr Zhigalev ’s name on the basis of those ORG , had been found to be unlawful by the firstinstance court .

CARDINAL . It further noted that it followed from the applicant ’s appeal that the only ground for quashing that court ’s judgment was its refusal to examine the applicant ’s submission concerning the limitation period . However , the court held that , pursuant to LAW , only a party to a case was entitled to request the application of a limitation period . As the applicant was not a party to the case it was not open to him to lodge such a request . The court dismissed the appeal and upheld the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant lodged a cassation appeal , in which he requested that the decisions of the lower courts be quashed as they had allegedly been delivered in breach of the procedural and material law . In particular , he complained that his request for participation in the proceedings in the capacity of a defendant had been unlawfully rejected , which allegedly deprived him of the possibility to assert his rights to the land . The appeal was examined on DATE by ORG of ORG , sitting as a bench of CARDINAL judges , in the presence of the parties and Mr Zhigalev as a third party . The court summarised its findings as follows .

CARDINAL . It followed from the materials of the case file that , in accordance with Resolutions no . CARDINAL and no . CARDINAL , issued by the Head of ORG , the land had been given to each of the partners in ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP However , ORG had been issued in Mr ORG ’s name as the owner of the land , without specifying the shares of the other CARDINAL partners in the farm .

CARDINAL . As these Land Certificates contradicted ORG no . CARDINAL and section CARDINAL of LAW , which provided that the property of a farm belonged to its members as common share property or common joint property , the first - instance court ’s decision to declare null and void LAW issued in Mr Zhigalev ’s name had been wellfounded .
CARDINAL . Resolutions nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL of ORG , pursuant to which the plots of land had been allotted for the founding of ORG , had been adopted in accordance with the legislation .

CARDINAL . As regards the applicant ’s complaint alleging the court ’s failure to join him to the proceedings as a co - defendant , the first - instance court had rightly rejected this request and ordered that the applicant be joined to the proceedings as a third party , because the claims concerned documents adopted by ORG and ORG . The claims had been admitted by the defendants . The parties to the proceedings had not raised the issue of the expiry of a limitation period . Mr ORG was not a party to the present dispute and the right to request the application of a limitation period was therefore not vested in him .
CARDINAL . In those circumstances the judgment of the first - instance court and the decision of the appeal court had been lawful and well - founded .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG of ORG upheld the judgment of ORG of GPE of DATE and the decision of ORG of GPE of DATE .

CARDINAL . Following the outcome of the above proceedings , on DATE ORG no . CARDINAL , in which it ordered that the old Land Certificates no . DATE and no . DATE be annulled and a new ORG be issued to ORG by ORG in accordance with ORG Resolution no . CARDINAL of DATE and LAW . In pursuance of Resolution no . CARDINAL ORG issued a new ORG , numbered DATE , which stated that ORG owned the plot of CARDINAL hectares , and that each of the CARDINAL partners in ORG owned a share of CARDINAL hectares of that land .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr Zhigalev , acting as head of the farm , brought an action on behalf of ORG before ORG of GPE against ORG . He requested that ORG no . CARDINAL , by which he had allegedly been deprived of his rights to the land , and ORG no . DATE be declared void .

CARDINAL . By ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE ORG annulled its ORG no . CARDINAL , considering that it had been adopted erroneously . On DATE the court terminated the proceedings in respect of the applicant ’s claim concerning ORG no . CARDINAL , on the ground that the said ORG had already been quashed .
CARDINAL . The court examined the applicant ’s request to annul ORG no . DATE and granted it for the following reasons , as stated in its judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . Resolution no . CARDINAL , on the basis of which ORG had been issued , had been quashed .

DATE . According to the relevant legislation in force at the material time ( the PERSON on LAW and Decrees no . CARDINAL of DATE and no . CARDINAL of DATE of the President of GPE ) , the correct legal document certifying an individual ’s right to land was a registered “ LAW ” ( свидетельство о государственной регистрации прав на землю ) and not a “ LAW ” ( государственный акт на землю ) .

CARDINAL . The court further addressed the applicant ’s argument that ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE was null and void in that it had allotted the land to each of the CARDINAL farmers in equal shares , allegedly in breach of the law . The court held that this issue had already been examined in the earlier proceedings , which had ended with the judgment of ORG of GPE of DATE , as upheld by higher courts , whereby the application to have ORG no . CARDINAL declared null and void had been dismissed . In accordance with LAW no . CARDINAL of ORG of DATE , the above judgment was binding , and the facts once established in a previously decided case were not subject to proof again in a case involving the same persons .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG quashed the decision of DATE of ORG of GPE , whereby that court had terminated the proceedings with regard to the applicant ’s claim in respect of Resolution no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . During a fresh examination of this part of the case by ORG of GPE , the applicant specified his claims . He asserted that ORG no . CARDINAL violated the rights of ORG and his rights as a founder of the farm by depriving the farm of its right of ownership to QUANTITY and its right of life - time inheritable possession to QUANTITY . Mr Zhigalev claimed that all this land should belong to him as head of the farm because he was the only person whose name had appeared on ORG no . DATE and no . DATE . In support of his claims the applicant referred to the unlawfulness of Resolutions no . CARDINAL of DATE and no . CARDINAL of DATE , issued by the Head of ORG , to the lawfulness of Land Certificates no . DATE and no . DATE , issued in his name , and to the fact that ORG had exceeded its authority when adopting ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE .

CARDINAL . A representative of the defendant ( that is , ORG ) submitted that the contested Resolution no . CARDINAL had merely followed the judgment of DATE of ORG of GPE , as upheld by higher courts , whereby Land Certificates no . DATE and no . DATE , issued in Mr ORG ’s name , had been declared null and void . Resolution no . CARDINAL had then been reversed because it had been adopted erroneously . The defendant authority further submitted that the applicant now had no documents certifying his title to the land and that neither ORG nor ORG had taken any measures to confiscate the land from ORG , which could continue farming it .

CARDINAL . The court pointed out that the judgment of ORG of GPE of DATE had declared null and void ORG no . DATE , issued by ORG pursuant to ORG no . CARDINAL , because , in accordance with the legislation then in force , the correct legal document certifying rights to land was a Land Title Certificate , issued by a Department of ORG for ORG Property and Transactions with Immovable Property .

CARDINAL . The court noted that the legal documents establishing the rights to the land in the present case were Resolutions no . CARDINAL and no . CARDINAL of DATE , issued by the Head of ORG . These ORG had been declared lawful by the final judgment of ORG of GPE of DATE , as upheld by higher courts . The applicant ’s argument concerning the unlawfulness of the said Resolutions was therefore unfounded .

CARDINAL . The court further noted that Land Certificates no . DATE and no . DATE , which were the legal documents certifying the rights to the land , had been declared unlawful by the above - mentioned court judgment , which was final . The applicant ’s contention about the lawfulness of these Land Certificates was thus also unfounded .

DATE . In so far as the applicant claimed that ORG no . CARDINAL infringed upon the rights of ORG to the plots of land measuring QUANTITY , the court found that neither ORG nor ORG had taken any measures to confiscate the land from ORG or any other actions which would prevent the farm from cultivating the land . This fact was not disputed by the applicant , who submitted to the court that the land had not been farmed for DATE because he had been involved in litigation .

CARDINAL . The court found that ORG no . CARDINAL had no adverse effect on the land rights of GPE . As to PERSON rights , the court had previously given decisions in this respect which had binding effect , and commercial courts no longer had jurisdiction over such claims .
CARDINAL . By a judgment of DATE ORG of the Kursk Region therefore dismissed the applicant ’s claims . The judgment was upheld by a decision of ORG of ORG of DATE .

CARDINAL . Luch Farm was involved in various other court proceedings during DATE , including proceedings with regard to tax disputes . It was represented in court by PERSON Zhigalev as head of the farm .
CARDINAL . Resolution no . CARDINAL of DATE stated :
“ HEAD OF THE BOLSHESOLDATSKIY DISTRICT ADMINISTRATION ,
ORG REGION
RESOLUTION
DATE , no . CARDINAL
[ the village of ] ORG
‘ On the allocation of a plot of land for the purpose of setting up PERSON Farm’

Having examined the application from Mr ORG concerning the allocation of a plot of land for the purpose of organising ORG , and governed by the RSFSR “ Farming Enterprise Act ” , by ORG and ORG of DATE on additional measures to expedite land reform in the ORG , and by LAW ,
I hereby order :

CARDINAL . that a plot of land with an overall area of QUANTITY , including CARDINAL ha of arable land , be allocated free of charge as property [ ownership ] for the establishment of ORG , from the territory of the former collective farm PERSON ( in accordance with the applications submitted to the administration of the ORG collective farm and on the basis of the decision by the collective farm ’s administration on the withdrawal as members of the collective farm , with a share of land and a stock share , of PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON ) .
that a plot of land measuring QUANTITY in total , QUANTITY of which are to be arable land , is to be transferred from a special fund to ORG on a DATE lease .
CARDINAL . That PERSON be confirmed as head of ORG , and that the following individuals be confirmed as partners in the farm :
CARDINAL . PERSON
CARDINAL . S.V. Kapustin
CARDINAL . N.N. Belov
CARDINAL . PERSON
CARDINAL . PERSON

CARDINAL . NORP That ORG and ORG carry out landdevelopment work by DATE in order to delimit the plot of land on site ( on the terrain ) , and draw up a state certificate on the right to use the land [ land certificate ] .
Head of the ORG [ signed by ] D. Shatalov ”
CARDINAL . Resolution no . CARDINAL of DATE stated as follows :
“ HEAD OF THE BOLSHESOLDATSKIY DISTRICT ADMINISTRATION ,
ORG REGION
RESOLUTION
DATE , no . CARDINAL
[ the village of ] ORG
‘ On the amendment of resolution no . CARDINAL of DATE by of the Head of the administration ”
On the basis of the application from Mr V.A. ORG , as head of the farming enterprise ‘ Luch’ , concerning the allocation of CARDINAL hectares of arable land in life - time inheritable possession ,
I hereby order :

CARDINAL . NORP that clause no . CARDINAL paragraph CARDINAL of resolution no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE by the Head of the administration “ On the allocation of a plot of land for the purpose of setting up ORG ” be considered invalid and be [ re]stated as follows :
‘ That QUANTITY of arable land is to be transferred from a special land fund to ORG in life - time inheritable possession , in the following shares :
CARDINAL . V.A. ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL ha [ hectares ]
CARDINAL . GPE Gerasimov CARDINAL ha [ hectares ]
CARDINAL . S.V. ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL ha [ hectares ]
CARDINAL . N.N. Belov CARDINAL.CARDINAL ha [ hectares ]
CARDINAL . A.A. Kazyulkin CARDINAL ha [ hectares ]
CARDINAL . A.F. ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL ha [ hectares]’
[ signed by ] S. ORG , First Deputy Head of the ORG , for the Head of the Administration ”
CARDINAL . The applicant submitted to the ORG a copy of ORG no . DATE which stated :
“ STATE CERTIFICATE
on rights of ownership of land , life - time inheritable possession and ( permanent ) use of land without limit of time
no . DATE
This state certificate is issued to the following owner , property - holder and/or user of the land :
PERSON , of the farming enterprise ‘ Luch’ , GPE , GPE village ,
by ORG ,

Confirming that , by ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE of ORG , the above mentioned owner , property - holder and/or user of the land is allocated in total QUANTITY of land , including QUANTITY as property [ ownership ] , free of charge , and QUANTITY as a life - time inheritable possession , as indicated on the plan , in order to set up the farming enterprise ‘ Luch’ .
ORG is drawn up in CARDINAL copies : the first is issued to PERSON ( the owner , property - holder and/or user of the land ) , the second is to be kept by ORG .
The certificate is registered as no . CARDINAL in LAW on property , possession and land - use rights .
[ signed by ] PERSON , Head of ORG

ORG ( the owner , property - holder and/or user of the land )
( hectares )
[ the ORG is signed by ] PERSON , ORG and ORG of GPE

CARDINAL . At the time that ORG was founded , the establishment and activity of farming enterprises were regulated by ORG ” ( О крестьянском ( фермерском ) хозяйстве ) no . CARDINAL - CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . Under LAW , a farm may be comprised of CARDINAL individual , a family or a group of persons . The head of a farm is CARDINAL of its capable partners . He or she represents the farm in dealings with enterprises , organisations , citizens and state organs .

CARDINAL . Under LAW , on the basis of an application from an individual wishing to set up a farm , a plot of land is transferred to him or her in use , in life - time inheritable possession or in ownership by a decision of the local authority . The number of partners in a farm is taken into account in determining the size of a plot of land to be allotted for setting it up .
Where a plot of land is transferred in ownership , a decision by the local authority serves as a basis for issuing a ORG , which certifies the ownership of the land .
The land for setting up a farm is transferred in ownership free of charge within statutory norms , and is subject to payment in cases exceeding such norms .

CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL of the LAW , local , district and town authorities establish land funds for the purpose of organizing farms by , inter alia , taking land from collective farms on receipt of applications from individuals wishing to set up farms . Members of a collective farm are entitled to leave it , to receive a plot of land and to found their own farming enterprise . Their applications are examined by the collective farm ’s administration then by the local district or town authority , which takes the final decision ( section CARDINAL of the LAW ) .
CARDINAL . Under LAW , the property of a farming enterprise comprises plants , buildings , cattle , equipment and machinery , vehicles and other property necessary for carrying out its activity .

CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL of the LAW , the property of a farming enterprise belongs to its partners in common share ownership or in common joint ownership , if the latter course has been decided unanimously by those partners .

CARDINAL . According to LAW of DATE , certain categories of land may only be owned as a “ life - time inheritable possession ” ( право пожизненного наследуемого владения ) , which means that the land may be possessed , used and left to one ’s successors , but may not be sold to anyone except the ORG .
CARDINAL . According to LAW , in force at the material time , CARDINAL parties enjoy full and equal procedural rights in proceedings , namely the plaintiff and the defendant .

CARDINAL . Under LAW , third parties with their own claims in respect of the subject - matter of a dispute may join the proceedings prior to the court ’s delivery of a judgment . They enjoy practically all the procedural rights of a plaintiff .

CARDINAL . Under LAW , third parties without their own claims in respect of the subject - matter of a dispute may join the proceedings on the side of the plaintiff or defendant prior to the court ’s delivery of a judgment , provided that the judgment is liable to affect their rights or obligations towards CARDINAL of the parties to the case . They enjoy the same procedural rights as a party to the proceedings , save for the rights to abandon a suit , to alter its ground or subject - matter , to increase or reduce the amount of a claim , to accept a suit , to conclude a friendly settlement agreement and to request the execution of a judgment .

CARDINAL . According to LAW , a limitation period is to be applied by a court only at the request of a party to a dispute , and the request must be made prior to delivery of a judgment . Where such a request is made , the expiry of a limitation period may serve as a ground for the court to dismiss an action .
CARDINAL . Under LAW , the general limitation period for civil claims is DATE .
CARDINAL . Under LAW , an action seeking a remedy in the event of a void transaction may be brought within DATE of the date when the performance thereof commenced .
